channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: 35 years of Rosie
item.description:
Wednesday, November 2, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support 35 years of Rosie.

Rosies - Friends on the Street offers community, connection, and friendship to those who are homeless, at risk of homelessness, or experiencing hardship or socially isolation through street outreach. Since 1987 our teams of volunteers have shared friendship through basic hospitality and a warm smile ensuring that no Queenslander feels unloved of disconnected from their community. This month we celebrate 35 years of genuine human connection and invite you to join in the celebration - find out how by visiting our website: https://rosies.org.au/charity/thevanthatcan/

This Light Up is organised by: Rosies - Friends on the Street

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Lung Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, November 3, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to support Lung Cancer Awareness Month.

Lung Foundation Australia is the leading charity in Australia providing support and a voice for people living with a lung disease. Our mission is to improve lung health and reduce the impact of lung disease for all Australians by driving community awareness about lung health, funding world-class research, advocating for people with a lung condition, providing information and support for patients and facilitating best-practice training and education for health professionals. November is Lung Cancer Awareness Month where Lung Foundation Australia shines a light on lung cancer, Australia's biggest cancer killer. During November we raise awareness and funds to support research breakthroughs into lung cancer, providing hope to the 13,250 Australians diagnosed each year.

This Light Up is organised by: Lung Foundation Australia

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Virtus Oceania Asia Games
item.description:
Saturday, November 5, 2022

Brisbane City Hall will be lit Blue, Purple and Orange to support Virtus Oceania Asia Games.

Included Through Sport. Sport Inclusion Australia is proud to host the inaugural Virtus Oceania Asia Games (OA Games), the largest elite intellectually impaired sporting event being held in Brisbane between 5-11 November 2022. 

This will be the first time a Virtus Regional Games will be held for the Oceania Asia region, with up to 1000 elite athletes and officials from New Zealand, Asia and Pacific Nations coming to Brisbane to  participate in the OA Games in November 2022.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council in partnership with Sports Inclusion Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support Cervical Cancer Awareness Week.

The Australian Cervical Cancer Foundation (ACCF) works in Australia and in developing countries (using its Overseas Relief Fund) to enhance and protect women’s health. ACCF programs help to eliminate cervical cancer through vaccination and screening and also the development of Awareness, Education and Support programs for cervical cancer and its prevention. National Cervical Cancer Awareness Week aims to raise awareness about cervical cancer and encourage Australians to engage in the conversation about cervical health.

item.description:
Monday, November 7, 2022

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Orange to support Colour the World Orange awareness campaign for CRPS and RSD.

CRPS Network Australia Inc. was formed to support Australian research, create awareness, provide education on this little known disorder and support those living with Complex Regional Pain Syndrome.

Colour The World Orange is an annual event held the first Monday of November to spread awareness of CRPS/RSD

This Light Up is organised by: Colour the World Orange Group

item.title: Remembrance Day
item.description:
Friday, November 11, 2022

Brisbane City Hall will be lit Red to support Remembrance Day.

Remembrance Day on November 11 is commemorated on the anniversary of the end of World War 1, but it is also a day to remember those who have died in service across all conflicts. It is a day to take part in the minute's silence on Remembrance Day, honouring those who have died whilst serving.

This Light Up is organised by: RSL Queensland

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

Friday, November 11, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Remembrance Day.

Remembrance Day on November 11 is commemorated on the anniversary of the end of World War 1, but it is also a day to remember those who have died in service across all conflicts. It is a day to take part in the minute's silence on Remembrance Day, honouring those who have died whilst serving.

This Light Up is organised by: RSL Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Pneumolight
item.description:
Saturday, November 12, 2022

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Blue to support Pneumolight.

The Worldwide Pneumonia Awareness Campaign-Pneumolight is a social impact action campaign, designed to raise awareness about pneumonia worldwide. By illuminating monuments worldwide we aim to increase visibility of pneumonia and disseminate information about this preventable disease.

This Light Up is organised by: NEUMOAI

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: MELT Festival
item.description:
Sunday, November 13, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to support MELT Festival.

MELT Festival, presented by Brisbane Powerhouse, returns in 2022 from 10 – 27 November.
An unabashed celebration of queer art, artists and ideas – MELT Festival 2022 will feature international music icons headlining the event, alongside national and local performers.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

item.title: Nepal Festival
item.description:
Sunday, November 13, 2022

Brisbane City Hall will be lit Blue, White and Red to support Nepal Festival.

The Nepal Festival 2022 Brisbane will showcase Nepal, Nepali culture and our rich heritage, help to preserve Nepali culture amongst Nepalese Communities in Brisbane, and bring the Nepali communities together on 13 November 2022 in King George Square.

This Light Up is organised by: Non-Resident Nepali Association (NRNA) Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Diabetes Day
item.description:
Monday, November 14, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support World Diabetes Day.

Diabetes Queensland is a charity and membership organisation that has been providing education, advice, ongoing support and advocacy to Queenslanders living with diabetes and those at risk, for more than 50 years. Today, 1 in 4 Queenslanders is either living with or at risk of developing diabetes; making it the number one cost to the health dollar and Australia’s fastest-growing chronic disease. World Diabetes Day raises awareness and funds to help Diabetes Queensland achieve its objectives.

This Light Up is organised by: Diabetic Association of Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Tuesday, November 15, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Eve of World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day
item.description:
Wednesday, November 16, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Eve of World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day.

PanKind, The Australian Pancreatic Cancer Foundation aims to triple the survival rate of pancreatic cancer by 2030, and dramatically improve quality of life for those impacted by the disease. November is Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Month, so we aim to light up Australia to help raise awareness and funds for pancreatic cancer research.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Pancreatic Cancer Foundation

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: World Prematurity Day
item.description:
Thursday, November 17, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support World Prematurity Day.

The Preterm Infants Parents Association Inc. (PIPA) is a charity which offers practical and emotional support to the families of infants born premature. Its goal is to raise awareness of premature birth and to provide information, support, understanding and encouragement to parents as they navigate the roller coaster ride of having and raising a child born too soon.

World Prematurity Day is celebrated on 17 November each year to raise awareness of the 15 million babies born premature world wide and the nearly 1 million who lose their fight for life. Over. 26,000 of these are born in Australia and approx.5700 in Queensland. It is also an opportunity for charities like PIPA to raise awareness its activities. Landmarks around the world will be lit up purple.

This Light Up is organised by: Preterm Infants Parents Association - PIPA

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: White Ribbon Day
item.description:
Friday, November 18, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit White to support White Ribbon Day.

White Ribbon Australia is a part of a global social movement working to eliminate gendered violence. We strive for an Australian society where all women and children are safe. White Ribbon is the world’s largest movement engaging men and boys to end men’s violence against women and girls, promote gender equality and create new opportunities for men to build positive, healthy and respectful relationships. The White Ribbon Australia movement works through a primary prevention approach. Held yearly White Ribbon Day is our signature campaign where we ask Australian communities to host events, fundraise and raise awareness for White Ribbon Australia and our primary prevention work.

This Light Up is organised by: White Ribbon Australia & Department of Transport and Main Roads

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Ag Day
item.description:
Saturday, November 19, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Green to support National Ag Day.

AgForce is the peak NFP organisation representing Queensland's rural producers. We exist to ensure the long-term growth, viability, competitiveness, and profitability of broadacre industries of cattle, grain, cane, sheep and wool in Queensland. We would like to light the bridge to bring awareness to and celebrate National Ag Day. Whether city or bush-based, Australians are all motivated to create a better future for our families and our environment. We all live in the same modern world and share the same progressive values. This National Ag Day help us celebrate the fact, we are all a part of the same cycle, all moving in the same direction.

This Light Up is organised by: AgForce Queensland Farmers Ltd

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Transgender Day of Remembrance
item.description:
Sunday, November 20, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue, white and pink to support Transgender Day of Remembrance.

Many Genders One Voice holds a Transgender Day of Remembrance ceremony every year, as part of other international events that occur during Transgender Awareness Week. This week aims to help raise the visibility of transgender, gender diverse and non-binary people, and address the issues the community faces. The final day of Transgender Awareness Week is Transgender Day of Remembrance (TDOR), an annual observance on November 20 that honours the memory of those whose lives were lost in acts of anti-transgender violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Aids Council

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: National Asbestos Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, November 21, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to support National Asbestos Awareness Week.

The Asbestos Disease Support Society Limited is a registered charity whose mission is to provide: -Support: for sufferers of asbestos related diseases, their families and carers -Advocacy: be a leading voice on asbestos related matters -Awareness: increasing awareness of the health risks associated with exposure to asbestos in the broader community -Education: work with individuals, organisations and health professionals to better understand asbestos disease. National Asbestos Awareness Week is held from Monday 21/11/22 to Sunday 27/11/22 to raise awareness about asbestos related diseases, to remember the many thousands of people who have died as a result of an asbestos related diseases and to encourage Australians to protect themselves against exposure to asbestos-containing materials, particularly when doing home renovations.

This Light Up is organised by: Asbestos Disease Support Society Limited

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.xCal:description:
Brisbane City Hall will be lit Blue to support National Asbestos Awareness Week. The Asbestos Disease Support Society Limited is a registered charity whose mission is to provide:
  • Support: for sufferers of asbestos related diseases, their families and carers
  • Advocacy: be a leading voice on asbestos related matters
  • Awareness: increasing awareness of the health risks associated with exposure to asbestos in the broader community
  • Education: work with individuals, organisations and health professionals to better understand asbestos disease.
National Asbestos Awareness Week is held from Monday 21 to Sunday 27 November to raise awareness about asbestos related diseases, to remember the many thousands of people who have died as a result of an asbestos related diseases and to encourage Australians to protect themselves against exposure to asbestos-containing materials, particularly when doing home renovations. This Light Up is organised by: Asbestos Disease Support Society Limited

item.title: Zonta Says No to Violence Against Women
item.description:
Tuesday, November 22, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to support Zonta Says No To Violence Against Women.

The Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc, a member of Zonta International, raises funds annually to support local projects towards a common goal – to improve the legal, educational, economic, political and health status of women. The Club is not for profit, run by volunteers and all funds raised are directed to projects, such as educational scholarships for women, support to women refuges and support services such as Brisbane Domestic Violence Service. Annually the Zonta Clubs of Brisbane conduct a campaign, under the Banner Zonta Says No to Violence against Women, to raise awareness of domestic and family violence in the community and to support women and their children when they find themselves in such a situation. It is proposed to Paint Brisbane Orange by lighting up key bridges and buildings and to engage the Brisbane community to join the campaign. A walk will be held on the night of the light up.

This Light Up is organised by: Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
